steps.heading: Introduction
steps.content: This tutorial introduces you to the basics of Kubernetes.

learnMore.title: Duration
learnMore.doc: It should take you about **5 minutes** to walk through this interactive tutorial.

alternate.doc: Learn more about using the IBM Cloud

steps.heading: Resources as YAML
steps.content: In Kubernetes, resources are described by YAML files.

learnMore.doc: - You need not use Kui's built-in editor. You may use your favorite code editor, and continue to leverage Kui for visual assistance.

steps.heading: Deploying Resources
steps.content: When you are ready to deploy a Kubernetes resource, you may use the **`kubectl create`** command. This will start an asynchronous activity to deploy all of the resources described by your YAML file.

learnMore.doc: - You may also apply updates to a deployed resource by using the **`kubectl apply`** command

nextSteps.doc: Kui will present you with a table that shows the ongoing status of the deployment.

steps.heading: Listing Resources
steps.content: You may list deployed resources using the **kubectl get** command.

learnMore.doc: - Try adding **`--watch`** or **`-w`** to the suggested commands on the right. This will tell Kui to have the table show the **ongoing** status of each resource.

steps.heading: Deleting Resources
steps.content: Once deployed, you may delete a resource by using the **kubectl delete** command.

nextSteps.doc: Kui will present you with a table that shows the ongoing status of the deletion.

steps.heading: Conclusion
steps.content: Congraulations, you have completed the Kubernetes Basics tutorial. Next, consider trying one of the other tutorials on the right.

nextSteps.doc: Learn more about using the IBM Cloud.
